name: Dill Pickles
keywords: Dill Pickles, Pickles, Cucumber, Pickling, Snack, Condiment, Easy, Homemade, Polish, Vinegar, Garlic, Dill, Refrigerator Pickles, Quick Pickles, Canning
description: Incredibly easy and quick to make pickles that can easily be changed up to have a huge variety in flavors.

recipeInstructions.text: Sanitize jars by boiling them in hot water. Leave it in simmering water until you're ready to fill the jar.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep Jars

recipeInstructions.text: Combine brine in a pot and bring to a boil. Stire for a couple of minutes and then turn it off to let it cool slightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep brine

recipeInstructions.text: Cut cucumbers into slices that fit into the jars. Remove jars and fill with desired ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill jars

recipeInstructions.text: Poor brine over the top and ensure cucumbers are covered and not poking out the top. Put the lids on and let cool before refridgerating.
recipeInstructions.name: Seal jars

recipeInstructions.text: Ready to go after a couple of weeks.
recipeInstructions.name: Store

notes: These pickles are amazingly simple and versatile. The base recipe is always the same and then you can add whatever extra flavorings you like!
My favorite combo of extra flavors are jalapenos, black pepper, mustard seeds, onion and garlic.
For faster pickles, you can enjoy them within a couple of days, but the flavor will deepen over time.
